verses.arabic: الٓر ۚ تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَقُرْءَانٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.translation: A. L. R. These are the Ayats of Revelation,- of a Qur'an that makes things clear.

verses.arabic: رُّبَمَا يَوَدُّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ مُسْلِمِينَ
verses.translation: Again and again will those who disbelieve, wish that they had bowed (to Allah's will) in Islam.
verses.transliteration: Rubama yawaddu allatheenakafaroo law kanoo muslimeen

verses.arabic: ذَرْهُمْ يَأْكُلُوا۟ وَيَتَمَتَّعُوا۟ وَيُلْهِهِمُ ٱلْأَمَلُ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: Leave them alone, to enjoy (the good things of this life) and to please themselves: let (false) hope amuse them: soon will knowledge (undeceive them).
verses.transliteration: Tharhum ya/kuloo wayatamattaAAoowayulhihimu al-amalu fasawfa yaAAlamoon

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا وَلَهَا كِتَابٌ مَّعْلُومٌ
verses.translation: Never did We destroy a population that had not a term decreed and assigned beforehand.
verses.transliteration: Wama ahlakna min qaryatin illawalaha kitabun maAAloom

verses.arabic: مَّا تَسْبِقُ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَمَا يَسْتَـْٔخِرُونَ
verses.translation: Neither can a people anticipate its term, nor delay it.
verses.transliteration: Ma tasbiqu min ommatin ajalahawama yasta/khiroon

verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِى نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ ٱلذِّكْرُ إِنَّكَ لَمَجْنُونٌ
verses.translation: They say: "O thou to whom the Message is being revealed! truly thou art mad (or possessed)!
verses.transliteration: Waqaloo ya ayyuha allatheenuzzila AAalayhi aththikru innaka lamajnoon

verses.arabic: لَّوْ مَا تَأْتِينَا بِٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
verses.translation: "Why bringest thou not angels to us if it be that thou hast the Truth?"
verses.transliteration: Law ma ta/teena bilmala-ikatiin kunta mina assadiqeen

verses.arabic: مَا نُنَزِّلُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ إِلَّا بِٱلْحَقِّ وَمَا كَانُوٓا۟ إِذًا مُّنظَرِينَ
verses.translation: We send not the angels down except for just cause: if they came (to the ungodly), behold! no respite would they have!
verses.transliteration: Ma nunazzilu almala-ikata illabilhaqqi wama kanoo ithan munthareen

verses.arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا ٱلذِّكْرَ وَإِنَّا لَهُۥ لَحَـٰفِظُونَ
verses.translation: We have, without doubt, sent down the Message; and We will assuredly guard it (from corruption).
verses.transliteration: Inna nahnu nazzalna aththikrawa-inna lahu lahafithoon

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ فِى شِيَعِ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.translation: We did send messengers before thee amongst the religious sects of old:
verses.transliteration: Walaqad arsalna min qablika feeshiyaAAi al-awwaleen

verses.arabic: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
verses.translation: But never came a messenger to them but they mocked him.
verses.transliteration: Wama ya/teehim min rasoolin illakanoo bihi yastahzi-oon

verses.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ نَسْلُكُهُۥ فِى قُلُوبِ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
verses.translation: Even so do we let it creep into the hearts of the sinners -

verses.arabic: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ ۖ وَقَدْ خَلَتْ سُنَّةُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.translation: That they should not believe in the (Message); but the ways of the ancients have passed away.
verses.transliteration: La yu/minoona bihi waqad khalatsunnatu al-awwaleen

verses.arabic: وَلَوْ فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِم بَابًا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَظَلُّوا۟ فِيهِ يَعْرُجُونَ
verses.translation: Even if We opened out to them a gate from heaven, and they were to continue (all day) ascending therein,
verses.transliteration: Walaw fatahna AAalayhim babanmina assama-i fathalloo feehiyaAArujoon

verses.arabic: لَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّمَا سُكِّرَتْ أَبْصَـٰرُنَا بَلْ نَحْنُ قَوْمٌ مَّسْحُورُونَ
verses.translation: They would only say: "Our eyes have been intoxicated: Nay, we have been bewitched by sorcery."
verses.transliteration: Laqaloo innama sukkirat absarunabal nahnu qawmun mashooroon

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَعَلْنَا فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ بُرُوجًا وَزَيَّنَّـٰهَا لِلنَّـٰظِرِينَ
verses.translation: It is We Who have set out the zodiacal signs in the heavens, and made them fair-seeming to (all) beholders;
verses.transliteration: Walaqad jaAAalna fee assama-iburoojan wazayyannaha linnathireen

verses.arabic: وَحَفِظْنَـٰهَا مِن كُلِّ شَيْطَـٰنٍ رَّجِيمٍ
verses.translation: And (moreover) We have guarded them from every cursed devil:

verses.arabic: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱسْتَرَقَ ٱلسَّمْعَ فَأَتْبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.translation: But any that gains a hearing by stealth, is pursued by a flaming fire, bright (to see).
verses.transliteration: Illa mani istaraqa assamAAafaatbaAAahu shihabun mubeen

verses.arabic: وَٱلْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَـٰهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِىَ وَأَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍ مَّوْزُونٍ
verses.translation: And the earth We have spread out (like a carpet); set thereon mountains firm and immovable; and produced therein all kinds of things in due balance.
verses.transliteration: Wal-arda madadnahawaalqayna feeha rawasiya waanbatnafeeha min kulli shay-in mawzoon

verses.arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا لَكُمْ فِيهَا مَعَـٰيِشَ وَمَن لَّسْتُمْ لَهُۥ بِرَٰزِقِينَ
verses.translation: And We have provided therein means of subsistence,- for you and for those for whose sustenance ye are not responsible.
verses.transliteration: WajaAAalna lakum feeha maAAayishawaman lastum lahu biraziqeen

verses.arabic: وَإِن مِّن شَىْءٍ إِلَّا عِندَنَا خَزَآئِنُهُۥ وَمَا نُنَزِّلُهُۥٓ إِلَّا بِقَدَرٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
verses.translation: And there is not a thing but its (sources and) treasures (inexhaustible) are with Us; but We only send down thereof in due and ascertainable measures.
verses.transliteration: Wa-in min shay-in illa AAindanakhaza-inuhu wama nunazziluhu illa biqadarinmaAAloom

verses.arabic: وَأَرْسَلْنَا ٱلرِّيَـٰحَ لَوَٰقِحَ فَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً فَأَسْقَيْنَـٰكُمُوهُ وَمَآ أَنتُمْ لَهُۥ بِخَـٰزِنِينَ
verses.translation: And We send the fecundating winds, then cause the rain to descend from the sky, therewith providing you with water (in abundance), though ye are not the guardians of its stores.
verses.transliteration: Waarsalna arriyaha lawaqihafaanzalna mina assama-i maanfaasqaynakumoohu wama antum lahu bikhazineen

verses.arabic: وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ نُحْىِۦ وَنُمِيتُ وَنَحْنُ ٱلْوَٰرِثُونَ
verses.translation: And verily, it is We Who give life, and Who give death: it is We Who remain inheritors (after all else passes away).

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْنَا ٱلْمُسْتَقْدِمِينَ مِنكُمْ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْنَا ٱلْمُسْتَـْٔخِرِينَ
verses.translation: To Us are known those of you who hasten forward, and those who lag behind.
verses.transliteration: Walaqad AAalimna almustaqdimeenaminkum walaqad AAalimna almusta/khireen

verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ حَكِيمٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.translation: Assuredly it is thy Lord Who will gather them together: for He is perfect in Wisdom and Knowledge.
verses.transliteration: Wa-inna rabbaka huwa yahshuruhuminnahu hakeemun AAaleem

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مِن صَلْصَـٰلٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ
verses.translation: We created man from sounding clay, from mud moulded into shape;
verses.transliteration: Walaqad khalaqna al-insana minsalsalin min hama-in masnoon

verses.arabic: وَٱلْجَآنَّ خَلَقْنَـٰهُ مِن قَبْلُ مِن نَّارِ ٱلسَّمُومِ
verses.translation: And the Jinn race, We had created before, from the fire of a scorching wind.
verses.transliteration: Waljanna khalaqnahumin qablu min nari assamoom

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ إِنِّى خَـٰلِقٌۢ بَشَرًا مِّن صَلْصَـٰلٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ
verses.translation: Behold! thy Lord said to the angels: "I am about to create man, from sounding clay from mud moulded into shape;
verses.transliteration: Wa-ith qala rabbuka lilmala-ikatiinnee khaliqun basharan min salsalin min hama-inmasnoon

verses.arabic: فَإِذَا سَوَّيْتُهُۥ وَنَفَخْتُ فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِى فَقَعُوا۟ لَهُۥ سَـٰجِدِينَ
verses.translation: "When I have fashioned him (in due proportion) and breathed into him of My spirit, fall ye down in obeisance unto him."
verses.transliteration: Fa-itha sawwaytuhu wanafakhtu feehimin roohee faqaAAoo lahu sajideen

verses.arabic: فَسَجَدَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ كُلُّهُمْ أَجْمَعُونَ
verses.translation: So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together:

verses.arabic: إِلَّآ إِبْلِيسَ أَبَىٰٓ أَن يَكُونَ مَعَ ٱلسَّـٰجِدِينَ
verses.translation: Not so Iblis: he refused to be among those who prostrated themselves.
verses.transliteration: Illa ibleesa aba an yakoonamaAAa assajideen

verses.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰٓإِبْلِيسُ مَا لَكَ أَلَّا تَكُونَ مَعَ ٱلسَّـٰجِدِينَ
verses.translation: (Allah) said: "O Iblis! what is your reason for not being among those who prostrated themselves?"
verses.transliteration: Qala ya ibleesu ma lakaalla takoona maAAa assajideen

verses.arabic: قَالَ لَمْ أَكُن لِّأَسْجُدَ لِبَشَرٍ خَلَقْتَهُۥ مِن صَلْصَـٰلٍ مِّنْ حَمَإٍ مَّسْنُونٍ
verses.translation: (Iblis) said: "I am not one to prostrate myself to man, whom Thou didst create from sounding clay, from mud moulded into shape."
verses.transliteration: Qala lam akun li-asjuda libasharinkhalaqtahu min salsalin min hama-in masnoon

verses.arabic: قَالَ فَٱخْرُجْ مِنْهَا فَإِنَّكَ رَجِيمٌ
verses.translation: (Allah) said: "Then get thee out from here; for thou art rejected, accursed.

verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكَ ٱللَّعْنَةَ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلدِّينِ
verses.translation: "And the curse shall be on thee till the day of Judgment."

verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرْنِىٓ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
verses.translation: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! give me then respite till the Day the (dead) are raised."

verses.arabic: قَالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُنظَرِينَ
verses.translation: (Allah) said: "Respite is granted thee

verses.arabic: إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْوَقْتِ ٱلْمَعْلُومِ
verses.translation: "Till the Day of the Time appointed."

verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ بِمَآ أَغْوَيْتَنِى لَأُزَيِّنَنَّ لَهُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَأُغْوِيَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.translation: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! because Thou hast put me in the wrong, I will make (wrong) fair-seeming to them on the earth, and I will put them all in the wrong,-
verses.transliteration: Qala rabbi bima aghwaytaneelaozayyinanna lahum fee al-ardi walaoghwiyannahumajmaAAeen

verses.arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَكَ مِنْهُمُ ٱلْمُخْلَصِينَ
verses.translation: "Except Thy servants among them, sincere and purified (by Thy Grace)."

verses.arabic: قَالَ هَـٰذَا صِرَٰطٌ عَلَىَّ مُسْتَقِيمٌ
verses.translation: (Allah) said: "This (way of My sincere servants) is indeed a way that leads straight to Me.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ عِبَادِى لَيْسَ لَكَ عَلَيْهِمْ سُلْطَـٰنٌ إِلَّا مَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلْغَاوِينَ
verses.translation: "For over My servants no authority shalt thou have, except such as put themselves in the wrong and follow thee."
verses.transliteration: Inna AAibadee laysa laka AAalayhimsultanun illa mani ittabaAAaka mina alghaween

verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ لَمَوْعِدُهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.translation: And verily, Hell is the promised abode for them all!

verses.arabic: لَهَا سَبْعَةُ أَبْوَٰبٍ لِّكُلِّ بَابٍ مِّنْهُمْ جُزْءٌ مَّقْسُومٌ
verses.translation: To it are seven gates: for each of those gates is a (special) class (of sinners) assigned.
verses.transliteration: Laha sabAAatu abwabin likullibabin minhum juz-on maqsoom

verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى جَنَّـٰتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
verses.translation: The righteous (will be) amid gardens and fountains (of clear-flowing water).

verses.arabic: ٱدْخُلُوهَا بِسَلَـٰمٍ ءَامِنِينَ
verses.translation: (Their greeting will be): "Enter ye here in peace and security."

verses.arabic: وَنَزَعْنَا مَا فِى صُدُورِهِم مِّنْ غِلٍّ إِخْوَٰنًا عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مُّتَقَـٰبِلِينَ
verses.translation: And We shall remove from their hearts any lurking sense of injury: (they will be) brothers (joyfully) facing each other on thrones (of dignity).
verses.transliteration: WanazaAAna ma fee sudoorihimmin ghillin ikhwanan AAala sururin mutaqabileen

verses.arabic: لَا يَمَسُّهُمْ فِيهَا نَصَبٌ وَمَا هُم مِّنْهَا بِمُخْرَجِينَ
verses.translation: There no sense of fatigue shall touch them, nor shall they (ever) be asked to leave.
verses.transliteration: La yamassuhum feeha nasabunwama hum minha bimukhrajeen

verses.arabic: ۞ نَبِّئْ عِبَادِىٓ أَنِّىٓ أَنَا ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
verses.translation: Tell My servants that I am indeed the Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful;

verses.arabic: وَأَنَّ عَذَابِى هُوَ ٱلْعَذَابُ ٱلْأَلِيمُ
verses.translation: And that My Penalty will be indeed the most grievous Penalty.

verses.arabic: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ عَن ضَيْفِ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ
verses.translation: Tell them about the guests of Abraham.

verses.arabic: إِذْ دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا۟ سَلَـٰمًا قَالَ إِنَّا مِنكُمْ وَجِلُونَ
verses.translation: When they entered his presence and said, "Peace!" He said, "We feel afraid of you!"
verses.transliteration: Ith dakhaloo AAalayhi faqaloosalaman qala inna minkum wajiloon

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَا تَوْجَلْ إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَـٰمٍ عَلِيمٍ
verses.translation: They said: "Fear not! We give thee glad tidings of a son endowed with wisdom."
verses.transliteration: Qaloo la tawjal innanubashshiruka bighulamin AAaleem

verses.arabic: قَالَ أَبَشَّرْتُمُونِى عَلَىٰٓ أَن مَّسَّنِىَ ٱلْكِبَرُ فَبِمَ تُبَشِّرُونَ
verses.translation: He said: "Do ye give me glad tidings that old age has seized me? Of what, then, is your good news?"
verses.transliteration: Qala abashshartumoonee AAalaan massaniya alkibaru fabima tubashshiroon

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ بَشَّرْنَـٰكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ فَلَا تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْقَـٰنِطِينَ
verses.translation: They said: "We give thee glad tidings in truth: be not then in despair!"
verses.transliteration: Qaloo bashsharnaka bilhaqqifala takun mina alqaniteen

verses.arabic: قَالَ وَمَن يَقْنَطُ مِن رَّحْمَةِ رَبِّهِۦٓ إِلَّا ٱلضَّآلُّونَ
verses.translation: He said: "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord, but such as go astray?"
verses.transliteration: Qala waman yaqnatu min rahmatirabbihi illa addalloon

verses.arabic: قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ أَيُّهَا ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
verses.translation: Abraham said: "What then is the business on which ye (have come), O ye messengers (of Allah)?"

verses.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّآ أُرْسِلْنَآ إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ مُّجْرِمِينَ
verses.translation: They said: "We have been sent to a people (deep) in sin,

verses.arabic: إِلَّآ ءَالَ لُوطٍ إِنَّا لَمُنَجُّوهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.translation: "Excepting the adherents of Lut: them we are certainly (charged) to save (from harm),- All -

verses.arabic: إِلَّا ٱمْرَأَتَهُۥ قَدَّرْنَآ ۙ إِنَّهَا لَمِنَ ٱلْغَـٰبِرِينَ
verses.translation: "Except his wife, who, We have ascertained, will be among those who will lag behind."

verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ءَالَ لُوطٍ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
verses.translation: At length when the messengers arrived among the adherents of Lut,

verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّكُمْ قَوْمٌ مُّنكَرُونَ
verses.translation: He said: "Ye appear to be uncommon folk."

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ بَلْ جِئْنَـٰكَ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ فِيهِ يَمْتَرُونَ
verses.translation: They said: "Yea, we have come to thee to accomplish that of which they doubt.
verses.transliteration: Qaloo bal ji/naka bimakanoo feehi yamtaroon

verses.arabic: وَأَتَيْنَـٰكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَإِنَّا لَصَـٰدِقُونَ
verses.translation: "We have brought to thee that which is inevitably due, and assuredly we tell the truth.

verses.arabic: فَأَسْرِ بِأَهْلِكَ بِقِطْعٍ مِّنَ ٱلَّيْلِ وَٱتَّبِعْ أَدْبَـٰرَهُمْ وَلَا يَلْتَفِتْ مِنكُمْ أَحَدٌ وَٱمْضُوا۟ حَيْثُ تُؤْمَرُونَ
verses.translation: "Then travel by night with thy household, when a portion of the night (yet remains), and do thou bring up the rear: let no one amongst you look back, but pass on whither ye are ordered."
verses.transliteration: Faasri bi-ahlika biqitAAin minaallayli wattabiAA adbarahum wala yaltafitminkum ahadun wamdoo haythutu/maroon

verses.arabic: وَقَضَيْنَآ إِلَيْهِ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْأَمْرَ أَنَّ دَابِرَ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ مَقْطُوعٌ مُّصْبِحِينَ
verses.translation: And We made known this decree to him, that the last remnants of those (sinners) should be cut off by the morning.
verses.transliteration: Waqadayna ilayhi thalikaal-amra anna dabira haola-i maqtooAAunmusbiheen

verses.arabic: وَجَآءَ أَهْلُ ٱلْمَدِينَةِ يَسْتَبْشِرُونَ
verses.translation: The inhabitants of the city came in (mad) joy (at news of the young men).

verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ ضَيْفِى فَلَا تَفْضَحُونِ
verses.translation: Lut said: "These are my guests: disgrace me not:

verses.arabic: وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَلَا تُخْزُونِ
verses.translation: "But fear Allah, and shame me not."

verses.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَوَلَمْ نَنْهَكَ عَنِ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.translation: They said: "Did we not forbid thee (to speak) for all and sundry?"
verses.transliteration: Qaloo awa lam nanhaka AAani alAAalameen

verses.arabic: قَالَ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ بَنَاتِىٓ إِن كُنتُمْ فَـٰعِلِينَ
verses.translation: He said: "There are my daughters (to marry), if ye must act (so)."

verses.arabic: لَعَمْرُكَ إِنَّهُمْ لَفِى سَكْرَتِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
verses.translation: Verily, by thy life (O Prophet), in their wild intoxication, they wander in distraction, to and fro.

verses.arabic: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلصَّيْحَةُ مُشْرِقِينَ
verses.translation: But the (mighty) Blast overtook them before morning,

verses.arabic: فَجَعَلْنَا عَـٰلِيَهَا سَافِلَهَا وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِّن سِجِّيلٍ
verses.translation: And We turned (the cities) upside down, and rained down on them brimstones hard as baked clay.
verses.transliteration: FajaAAalna AAaliyaha safilahawaamtarna AAalayhim hijaratan minsijjeel

verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍ لِّلْمُتَوَسِّمِينَ
verses.translation: Behold! in this are Signs for those who by tokens do understand.

verses.arabic: وَإِنَّهَا لَبِسَبِيلٍ مُّقِيمٍ
verses.translation: And the (cities were) right on the high-road.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Behold! in this is a sign for those who believed.

verses.arabic: وَإِن كَانَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْأَيْكَةِ لَظَـٰلِمِينَ
verses.translation: And the Companions of the Wood were also wrong-doers;

verses.arabic: فَٱنتَقَمْنَا مِنْهُمْ وَإِنَّهُمَا لَبِإِمَامٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.translation: So We exacted retribution from them. They were both on an open highway, plain to see.

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ كَذَّبَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْحِجْرِ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.translation: The Companions of the Rocky Tract also rejected the messengers:

verses.arabic: وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمْ ءَايَـٰتِنَا فَكَانُوا۟ عَنْهَا مُعْرِضِينَ
verses.translation: We sent them Our Signs, but they persisted in turning away from them.

verses.arabic: وَكَانُوا۟ يَنْحِتُونَ مِنَ ٱلْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا ءَامِنِينَ
verses.translation: Out of the mountains did they hew (their) edifices, (feeling themselves) secure.

verses.arabic: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلصَّيْحَةُ مُصْبِحِينَ
verses.translation: But the (mighty) Blast seized them of a morning,

verses.arabic: فَمَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
verses.translation: And of no avail to them was all that they did (with such art and care)!

verses.arabic: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ إِلَّا بِٱلْحَقِّ ۗ وَإِنَّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ لَـَٔاتِيَةٌ ۖ فَٱصْفَحِ ٱلصَّفْحَ ٱلْجَمِيلَ
verses.translation: We created not the heavens, the earth, and all between them, but for just ends. And the Hour is surely coming (when this will be manifest). So overlook (any human faults) with gracious forgiveness.
verses.transliteration: Wama khalaqna assamawatiwal-arda wama baynahuma illabilhaqqi wa-inna assaAAata laatiyatunfasfahi assafhaaljameel

verses.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ ٱلْخَلَّـٰقُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
verses.translation: For verily it is thy Lord who is the Master-Creator, knowing all things.

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَـٰكَ سَبْعًا مِّنَ ٱلْمَثَانِى وَٱلْقُرْءَانَ ٱلْعَظِيمَ
verses.translation: And We have bestowed upon thee the Seven Oft-repeated (verses) and the Grand Qur'an.
verses.transliteration: Walaqad ataynaka sabAAan minaalmathanee walqur-ana alAAatheem

verses.arabic: لَا تَمُدَّنَّ عَيْنَيْكَ إِلَىٰ مَا مَتَّعْنَا بِهِۦٓ أَزْوَٰجًا مِّنْهُمْ وَلَا تَحْزَنْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَٱخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Strain not thine eyes. (Wistfully) at what We have bestowed on certain classes of them, nor grieve over them: but lower thy wing (in gentleness) to the believers.
verses.transliteration: La tamuddanna AAaynayka ila mamattaAAna bihi azwajan minhum wala tahzanAAalayhim wakhfid janahaka lilmu/mineen

verses.arabic: وَقُلْ إِنِّىٓ أَنَا ٱلنَّذِيرُ ٱلْمُبِينُ
verses.translation: And say: "I am indeed he that warneth openly and without ambiguity,"-

verses.arabic: كَمَآ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَى ٱلْمُقْتَسِمِينَ
verses.translation: (Of just such wrath) as We sent down on those who divided (Scripture into arbitrary parts),-

verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ جَعَلُوا۟ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ عِضِينَ
verses.translation: (So also on such) as have made Qur'an into shreds (as they please).

verses.arabic: فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَسْـَٔلَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.translation: Therefore, by the Lord, We will, of a surety, call them to account,

verses.arabic: عَمَّا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.translation: For all their deeds.

verses.arabic: فَٱصْدَعْ بِمَا تُؤْمَرُ وَأَعْرِضْ عَنِ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
verses.translation: Therefore expound openly what thou art commanded, and turn away from those who join false gods with Allah.

verses.arabic: إِنَّا كَفَيْنَـٰكَ ٱلْمُسْتَهْزِءِينَ
verses.translation: For sufficient are We unto thee against those who scoff,-

verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَجْعَلُونَ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ ۚ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: Those who adopt, with Allah, another god: but soon will they come to know.
verses.transliteration: Allatheena yajAAaloona maAAa Allahiilahan akhara fasawfa yaAAlamoon

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ نَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ يَضِيقُ صَدْرُكَ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ
verses.translation: We do indeed know how thy heart is distressed at what they say.
verses.transliteration: Walaqad naAAlamu annaka yadeequ sadrukabima yaqooloon

verses.arabic: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَكُن مِّنَ ٱلسَّـٰجِدِينَ
verses.translation: But celebrate the praises of thy Lord, and be of those who prostrate themselves in adoration.

verses.arabic: وَٱعْبُدْ رَبَّكَ حَتَّىٰ يَأْتِيَكَ ٱلْيَقِينُ
verses.translation: And serve thy Lord until there come unto thee the Hour that is Certain.
